sprite_queue

Loading-queue to load image files from the cartridge one by one.  Would work GREAT if parallel operations (via threads or processes) were supported (not the case though).

Contains

  • char paths[SPRITE_LOADING_QUEUE_MAX][64] - file names to be loaded
  • sprite_t** sprites[SPRITE_LOADING_QUEUE_MAX] - buffers for the sprite-data
  • int append_index - current index to append to the queue
  • int hslices[SPRITE_LOADING_QUEUE_MAX] - in case any of the queued sprites should suppord animations
  • int vslices[SPRITE_LOADING_QUEUE_MAX] - in case any of the queued sprites should suppord animations
Summary
sprite_queueLoading-queue to load image files from the cartridge one by one.
Functions
tools_initInitializes all subsystems, must be called to make proper use of the library
tools_updateUpdate all requiered subsystems
tools_showRefresh the screen
tools_printPrint a debug-message on the console
fpsUpdaterUpdate display text to show frames per second
tools_changeGfxBytesKeep track of memory usage
tools_free_spriteFree sprite & register freed memory
tools_sprite_queue_has_nextIs there a sprite ready to pop from queue?
tools_push_to_sprite_queueAppend a request to the loading queue
sprite_queue_load_nextLoad the next element in queue from the cardridge
sprite_queue_shiftShifts the queue by one after an element was loaded

Functions

tools_init

void tools_init(char *ver,
display_context_t d,
int showFPS,
int showByteAllocation,
int console_auto_scroll)

Initializes all subsystems, must be called to make proper use of the library

Parameters

char* verstring for version id
display_context_t dreference to display
int showFPSflag for whether or not to display the framerate in debug-mode
int showByteAllocationflag for whether or not to display the memory-usage in debug-mode
int showByteAllocationflag for whether or not the debug-consoleshould scroll automatically

Returns

A pointer to a sprite-instance that contains the image data of the file

void tools_free_sprite(sprite_t *sprite)

Free sprite & register freed memory

Parameters

tools_sprite_queue_has_next

int tools_sprite_queue_has_next()

Is there a sprite ready to pop from queue?

Returns

1 if TRUE, 0 otherwise

tools_push_to_sprite_queue

void tools_push_to_sprite_queue(char path[],
int hslices,
int vslices,
sprite_t **buffer)

Append a request to the loading queue

Parameters

  • char path[] - path to the file on the cartridge
  • int hslices - number of horizontal slices of animation-franes (if any)
  • int vslices - number of vertical slices of animation-franes (if any)
  • sprite_t** buffer - pointer to the buffer to write the data into
